description: This document configure your Linux instance to use the Amazon Time Sync Service.

runCommand:
#!/bin/bash

set -eE
set -u
set -o pipefail

trap handle_error ERR

MAX_VERIFY_TRIES=30

handle_error() {
    echo "An unexpected error occurred. Exiting..."
    exit 1
}

unimplemented_step() {
    echo "Error: An unexpected error occurred. Exiting..."
    exit 1
}

verify_amazon_timesync_service_configured() {
    chronyc_cmd=$(which chronyc)
    if [[ -n "$chronyc_cmd" ]]; then
        $chronyc_cmd sources | grep -qE '^\^\* (169\.254\.169\.123|fd00:ec2::123)'
    else
        return 1
    fi
}

update_chrony_config_file() {
    ipv4_config_line="server 169.254.169.123 prefer iburst minpoll 4 maxpoll 4"
    ipv6_config_line="server fd00:ec2::123 prefer iburst minpoll 4 maxpoll 4"
    sed -E -i "0,/^(server|pool|! pool).*$/s//$ipv4_config_line\n$ipv6_config_line\n&/" "$chrony_config_file_path"
}

ubuntu_install_chrony() {
    apt update
    apt install -y chrony
}

sles_install_chrony() {
    zypper refresh
    zypper -n install chrony
}

install_chrony=unimplemented_step
configure_chrony_startup=unimplemented_step
restart_chrony=unimplemented_step
unset chrony_config_file_path

. /etc/os-release
OS_RELEASE="$ID${VERSION_ID:+.${VERSION_ID}}"
case "$OS_RELEASE" in
    ubuntu.18.04|ubuntu.20.04)
        install_chrony="ubuntu_install_chrony"
        configure_chrony_startup=""
        restart_chrony="/etc/init.d/chrony restart"
        chrony_config_file_path="/etc/chrony/chrony.conf"
        ;;
    sles.12.5)
        install_chrony="sles_install_chrony"
        configure_chrony_startup="systemctl enable chronyd"
        restart_chrony="systemctl restart chronyd"
        chrony_config_file_path="/etc/chrony.conf"
        ;;
esac

echo "Checking if Amazon time service already configured..."
if verify_amazon_timesync_service_configured; then
    echo "Service already configured. Exiting..."
    exit 0
fi

echo "Installing chrony..."
$install_chrony > /dev/null

echo "Configuring chrony service startup..."
$configure_chrony_startup > /dev/null

echo "Updating chrony configuration file..."
update_chrony_config_file > /dev/null

echo "Restarting chrony..."
$restart_chrony > /dev/null

echo "Verifying Amazon time service configured..."
for ((i=0; i<$MAX_VERIFY_TRIES; i++))
do
    if verify_amazon_timesync_service_configured; then
        echo "Done."
        exit 0
    fi
    sleep 1s
done

echo "Amazon time service configuration failed."
exit 1
